nodes.bodyText:
📝 Description

Minor changes to textual content, mainly some typos or duplicates

fix(listbox-docpage): note doublon from the with icons section
fix(dropdown-docpage): adding DropdownSection dependencu into the with-section code
fix(dropdown-docpage): do not need Button component on custom-trigger section code

nodes.title: feat(system): extend props for nextui provider
nodes.bodyText:
Resolves #1494
📝 Description
Since the OverlayProvider wraps its children in a div container at the top level of the app, this can cause the children to not inherit the layout of the body element.
While it's possible to set the layout for the container using selectors in a css file, but we could improve the DX by extending the props for NextUIProvider and passing them down to OverlayProvider. This way, we could directly set styles for the container by using className or style prop.
⛳️ Current behavior (updates)

Extend NextUIProviderProps from ModalProviderProps and pass these props down to overlayProvider.

🚀 New behavior

Update the default locale to en-US.

💣 Is this a breaking change (Yes/No):
No.

nodes.bodyText:

📝 Description
fix unable to Close NavbarMenu
⛳️ Current behavior (updates)
When you close and open (clicking) fastly multiple times the NavbarMenu, the Menu crashes and you are unable to close it. And you need to reload the browser to use your website!
🚀 New behavior
You can close it normally.
💣 Is this a breaking change (No):
📝 Additional Information

nodes.title: fix(shared-utils): expose getProp
nodes.bodyText:
📝 Description
Exposes the getProp helper function, which unlike getKeyValue, allows for retrieving properties from nested objects. This is helpful when working with dynamic Table instances.
⛳️ Current behavior (updates)
getProp is not exported for consumers to use.
🚀 New behavior
getProp can be properly imported for consumers to use.
💣 Is this a breaking change (Yes/No): No

📝 Additional Information

nodes.title: fix(docs): table async pagination
nodes.bodyText:
Closes #1466
📝 Description
Fixed pagination issue by changing from useAsyncList to useSWR. While useAsyncList is more suitable for infinite loading lists and could solve the problem of consecutive pagination clicks, it's not the optimal solution for jump-clicking. By using useSWR, we can request data only for the current page and cache previously requested data, providing a better user experience for interactions.
⛳️ Current behavior (updates)
Change useAsyncList to useSWR.
🚀 New behavior
Add swr
💣 Is this a breaking change (Yes/No):
No
📝 Additional Information

> > @jrgarciadev thank you for the review. IMO, disabling the `Pagination` can lead to a less smooth UX when users click on the next page button consecutively (requiring them to wait for the request to complete).

+---
+
+Fix dropdown trigger events and popover arrow styles

@@ -50,6 +50,7 @@ export function useReactAriaPopover(
     shouldCloseOnBlur = true,
     placement: placementProp = "top",
     containerPadding,
+    shouldCloseOnInteractOutside,
     isNonModal: isNonModalProp,
     isKeyboardDismissDisabled,
     ...otherProps
@@ -64,6 +65,14 @@ export function useReactAriaPopover(
       shouldCloseOnBlur,
       isDismissable: !isNonModal,
       isKeyboardDismissDisabled,
+      shouldCloseOnInteractOutside: shouldCloseOnInteractOutside
+        ? shouldCloseOnInteractOutside
+        : (element) => {
+            // Don't close if the click is within the trigger or the popover itself
+            let trigger = triggerRef?.current;
+
+            return !trigger || !trigger.contains(element);
+          },
     },
     popoverRef,
   );

@@ -22,7 +22,6 @@ const popover = tv({
     base: [
       "z-10",
       "relative",
-      "overflow-hidden",
       "inline-flex",
       "flex-col",
       "items-center",
@@ -39,7 +38,7 @@ const popover = tv({
     trigger: ["z-10"],
     backdrop: ["hidden"],
     arrow: [
-      "-z-10",
+      "z-[-1]",
       "absolute",
       "rotate-45",
       "bg-inherit",

nodes.title: docs(tooltip): decrease zIndex so it doesn't overlap other elements
nodes.bodyText:
📝 Description
The floating Tooltip was overlapping the navbar and other elements on the home page.
I decreased its z-index to 39 because the navbar is .z-40
⛳️ Current behavior (updates)

  
    
    

    fix-navbar-zindex.mp4
    
  

  

  


🚀 New behavior

  
    
    

    fixed-navbar-zindex.mp4
    
  

  

  


💣 Is this a breaking change (Yes/No):
No

@jvzaniolo is attempting to deploy a commit to the **NextUI** Team on [Vercel](https://vercel.com).

A member of the Team first needs to [authorize it](https://vercel.com/git/authorize?team=NextUI&type=github&job=%7B%22headInfo%22%3A%7B%22sha%22%3A%22227b79e5c6493084ee31a62fd5b13079c8a4a2e4%22%7D%2C%22id%22%3A%22QmSmhqUnBGU26HkdgPcxCaTTZ5KJCK2mFtLXoDb4aQBCAm%22%2C%22org%22%3A%22nextui-org%22%2C%22prId%22%3A1454%2C%22repo%22%3A%22nextui%22%7D).

![image](https://github.com/nextui-org/nextui/assets/25524993/7f34760c-8557-42b5-9915-cd71bdcd1d05)

We should just reduce the z-index of the tooltip, so we don't have to fix this in a bunch of places.

Hey @jguddas it can be done by doing this:

https://github.com/nextui-org/nextui/issues/1409#issuecomment-1679621977
@jrgarciadev @jguddas I decreased the tooltip z-index as mentioned :)
Thank you! @jvzaniolo

nodes.title: docs: correct default value for popover radius
nodes.bodyText:
📝 Description
set correct default value for radius popover prop in docs. xl is not even allowed.
this bothered me...

| **nextui-storybook-v2** | ✅ Ready ([Inspect](https://vercel.com/nextui-org/nextui-storybook-v2/GHvNXPR5Mo2E8SEqVpfx2P8YYYUC)) | [Visit Preview](https://vercel.live/open-feedback/nextui-storybook-v2-git-fork-ynn1k-ynn1k-patch-1-nextui-org.vercel.app?via=pr-comment-visit-preview-link&passThrough=1) | 💬 [**Add feedback**](https://vercel.live/open-feedback/nextui-storybook-v2-git-fork-ynn1k-ynn1k-patch-1-nextui-org.vercel.app?via=pr-comment-feedback-link) | Aug 21, 2023 0:41am |

@ynn1k is attempting to deploy a commit to the **NextUI** Team on [Vercel](https://vercel.com).

A member of the Team first needs to [authorize it](https://vercel.com/git/authorize?team=NextUI&type=github&job=%7B%22headInfo%22%3A%7B%22sha%22%3A%2238553d207d52976e8ca9c5893ccb819855729d4e%22%7D%2C%22id%22%3A%22QmcYVJtxp7ExXZysVCcH3QM1BnqAVkueySaGdnG3eGfF1W%22%2C%22org%22%3A%22nextui-org%22%2C%22prId%22%3A1451%2C%22repo%22%3A%22nextui%22%7D).
Hey @ynn1k thanks for send this PR, however, the default value is actually "lg" not "sm"

```suggestion
| radius                    | `none` \| `sm` \| `md` \| `lg` \| `full`                                    | The popover border radius.                                                                                                                                   | `lg`            |
```
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -140,7 +140,7 @@ You can customize the `Popover` component by passing custom Tailwind CSS classes
 | children\*                | `ReactNode[]`                                                               | The content of the popover. It's usually the `PopoverTrigger` and `PopoverContent`.                                                                          | -               |
 | size                      | `sm` \| `md` \| `lg`                                                        | The popover content font size.                                                                                                                               | `md`            |
 | color                     | `default` \| `primary` \| `secondary` \| `success` \| `warning` \| `danger` | The popover color theme.                                                                                                                                     | `default`       |
-| radius                    | `none` \| `sm` \| `md` \| `lg` \| `full`                                    | The popover border radius.                                                                                                                                   | `xl`            |
+| radius                    | `none` \| `sm` \| `md` \| `lg` \| `full`                                    | The popover border radius.                                                                                                                                   | `sm`            |

files_with_diffs.patch:
@@ -140,7 +140,7 @@ You can customize the `Popover` component by passing custom Tailwind CSS classes
 | children\*                | `ReactNode[]`                                                               | The content of the popover. It's usually the `PopoverTrigger` and `PopoverContent`.                                                                          | -               |
 | size                      | `sm` \| `md` \| `lg`                                                        | The popover content font size.                                                                                                                               | `md`            |
 | color                     | `default` \| `primary` \| `secondary` \| `success` \| `warning` \| `danger` | The popover color theme.                                                                                                                                     | `default`       |
-| radius                    | `none` \| `sm` \| `md` \| `lg` \| `full`                                    | The popover border radius.                                                                                                                                   | `xl`            |
+| radius                    | `none` \| `sm` \| `md` \| `lg` \| `full`                                    | The popover border radius.                                                                                                                                   | `lg`            |
 | shadow                    | `none` \| `sm` \| `md` \| `lg`                                              | The popover shadow.                                                                                                                                          | `lg`            |
 | backdrop                  | `transparent` \| `opaque` \| `blur`                                         | The popover backdrop type.                                                                                                                                   | `transparent`   |
 | placement                 | [PopoverPlacement](#popover-placement)                                      | The placement of the popover relative to its trigger reference.                                                                                              | `bottom`        |

nodes.title: updated doc handling hydration mismatch error

Address the error handling in ThemeSwitcher component specified in the doc

Implementation of dark mode result in hydration error while following the doc

🚀 New behavior

Resolved the mentioned error while replicating the dark mode mode feature from the doc.

💣 Is this a breaking change (Yes/No): No

📝 Additional Information

commit.message: updated doc handling hydration mismatch error

+```sh
+yarn add @nextui-org/use-aria-link
+# or
+npm i @nextui-org/use-aria-link
+```
+
+## Contribution

+Yes please! See the
+[contributing guidelines](https://github.com/nextui-org/nextui/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md)
+for details.
+
+## Licence

+[MIT license](https://github.com/nextui-org/nextui/blob/master/LICENSE).

nodes.title: fix: added value to aria label of select
nodes.bodyText:
Before it just read out the label i.e. Favorite Animal, now it reads out Dog, Favorite Animal.
I added a visually hidden comma so most screen readers put a liddle pause between the value and label.

commit.message: fix: added value to aria label of select

A member of the Team first needs to [authorize it](https://vercel.com/git/authorize?team=NextUI&type=github&job=%7B%22headInfo%22%3A%7B%22sha%22%3A%2281f1da1527b676e3f8c16177e987c46448d198c5%22%7D%2C%22id%22%3A%22QmSuoziPscqH428HT6pYSnfAVhEDLaga78gT2B5divhgVt%22%2C%22org%22%3A%22nextui-org%22%2C%22prId%22%3A1427%2C%22repo%22%3A%22nextui%22%7D).
The warning is justified regardless of element IMO.
@jguddas  we should ignore that warning if we don't use `onClick`

> @jguddas  we should ignore that warning if we don't use `onClick`
> 

If we have a link we should be using `useLink` not `useButton`.

Hey @camcam2605 thanks for contributing to NextUI. However, we should create our use-link hook to prevent this as we did with the button one https://github.com/nextui-org/nextui/blob/main/packages/hooks/use-aria-button/src/index.ts#L134-L136

I'll take this, thank you!

@@ -154,24 +154,31 @@ export function useButton(props: UseButtonProps) {
   const {isHovered, hoverProps} = useHover({isDisabled});
 
   const getButtonProps: PropGetter = useCallback(
-    (props = {}) => ({
-      "data-disabled": dataAttr(isDisabled),
-      "data-focus": dataAttr(isFocused),
-      "data-pressed": dataAttr(isPressed),
-      "data-focus-visible": dataAttr(isFocusVisible),
-      "data-hover": dataAttr(isHovered),
-      "data-loading": dataAttr(isLoading),
-      ...mergeProps(
-        ariaButtonProps,
-        focusProps,
-        hoverProps,
-        filterDOMProps(otherProps, {
-          enabled: shouldFilterDOMProps,
-        }),
-        filterDOMProps(props),
-      ),
-    }),
+    (props = {}) => {
+      if (Component !== 'button' && !onClick) {
+        delete ariaButtonProps['onClick'];
+      }
+      
+      return {
+        "data-disabled": dataAttr(isDisabled),
+        "data-focus": dataAttr(isFocused),
+        "data-pressed": dataAttr(isPressed),
+        "data-focus-visible": dataAttr(isFocusVisible),
+        "data-hover": dataAttr(isHovered),
+        "data-loading": dataAttr(isLoading),
+        ...mergeProps(
+          ariaButtonProps,
+          focusProps,
+          hoverProps,
+          filterDOMProps(otherProps, {
+            enabled: shouldFilterDOMProps,
+          }),
+          filterDOMProps(props),
+        ),        
+      };
+    },
     [
+      Component,
       isLoading,
       isDisabled,
       isFocused,
@@ -182,6 +189,7 @@ export function useButton(props: UseButtonProps) {
       ariaButtonProps,
       focusProps,
       hoverProps,
+      onClick,
       otherProps,
     ],
   );

Merging this PR will not cause a version bump for any packages. If these changes should not result in a new version, you're good to go. **If these changes should result in a version bump, you need to add a changeset.**

[Click here if you're a maintainer who wants to add a changeset to this PR](https://github.com/camcam2605/nextui/new/main-1?filename=.changeset/wicked-bugs-applaud.md&value=---%0A%22%40nextui-org%2Fnavbar%22%3A%20patch%0A---%0A%0Afix(navbar)%3A%20fixed%20menu%20open%20when%20passing%20disabledAnimation%0A)

@camcam2605 is attempting to deploy a commit to the **NextUI** Team on [Vercel](https://vercel.com).

A member of the Team first needs to [authorize it](https://vercel.com/git/authorize?team=NextUI&type=github&job=%7B%22headInfo%22%3A%7B%22sha%22%3A%225c36ab002ac42283e36ebfb580563d28361021f1%22%7D%2C%22id%22%3A%22QmbaETcL1tXRen3MH1msR2RmQV8mF2TyP6gYQTveGpiqYV%22%2C%22org%22%3A%22nextui-org%22%2C%22prId%22%3A1418%2C%22repo%22%3A%22nextui%22%7D).

Hey @camcam2605 could you describe the issue? when the animation is disabled the open/close styles are handled by tailwind classes, so this logic is not needed (unless I'm missing something):
```ts
disableAnimation ? (
  isMenuOpen && (
      <MenuWrapper>
      ...
 ```     


TailwindCSS Styles:

![CleanShot 2023-08-16 at 22 27 13@2x](https://github.com/nextui-org/nextui/assets/30373425/a0d6da92-e5ae-4443-9742-f19309d92c63)

@jrgarciadev  because the navbar menu using `RemoveScroll` package to disable scrolling. so even if styles are handled by tailwind, we still can't scroll the page. There are 3 ways to solve this bug: 

1. convert `isMenuOpen` to an boolean:

```
                <RemoveScroll forwardProps enabled={!!isMenuOpen} removeScrollBar={false}>
                    {children}
                </RemoveScroll>
```

2. set default value of `isMenuOpen` to `false` in `use-navbar` hook.
3. the way I am applying in the PR, I think it would be better to remove the navbar menu from the dom if it not visible.

Could you upload a reproduction video, please?

The `isMenuOpen` is already a `boolean` value, in case is it undefined the `RemoveScroll` library handles it 🤔

@jrgarciadev  yes.

this issue won't happen if I passing `isMenuOpen` as boolean value instead of undefined.

Example:
 ```
               <RemoveScroll forwardProps enabled={!!isMenuOpen} removeScrollBar={false}>
                    {children}
                </RemoveScroll>
```

https://github.com/nextui-org/nextui/assets/67684008/bd5743eb-c0ad-4afa-b9aa-e38703a2ee47
@jrgarciadev This PR can fix issue https://github.com/nextui-org/nextui/issues/1506 ?
